website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to features and quality, you won't find better shooting earmuffs.
pros: A top seller that offers excellent protection, noise reduction, and ambient noise amplification
Features low-profile design with patented air-flow technology and adjustable cushioned headband
cons: The costliest shooting earmuffs we tested

customer_reviews.title: Good outdoor ear protection
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a couple of years now and it works great for outdoor ranges. Can pick up the slightest of sounds when the volume is all the way up. Picked up the sound of my clothes rustling when brushing against myself. It could be used indoors as well but the sound protection isnt top notch inside, you definitely hear the gun more than other ear protection, but they do the job. Overall theyre comfortable and performs superbly outdoors. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Herman L.

customer_reviews.title: They're good, I just have a problem with the way they promoted but didn't deliver.
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, this is my second pair. They're great budget electronic hearing protection. Much better with Noisefighter gel pads though. However, when I bought my second pair they were promoting that it would include 50 N95 masks. Those were not included in my shipment. That's a bad business practice. If there's a reason for it, they should make it right. I'm not gonna say people shouldn't get them, but I wanted to put it out there.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware!!! These were advertised to include fifty N-95 face masks, wanted to donate them to local first responders. I thought it was to good to be true, and was right...no N-95's were included. Needed to update my old S&W headset anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Panzer H.

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Returning due to false advertising and baiting. When I ordered these, they were pictured with a box of 3M N95 masks as if you received a box of masks with the product. I thought, “well that at least makes them a better deal”, but no masks arrived with the headphones . It’s not about the masks, but the principle. Poor performance In any situation despite the current crisis....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT INCLUDE N95 MASKS AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with N95 facemasks. During the second week of March certain colors of this item showed that purchase of the muffs would come with 50 free N95 facemasks. Seemed quite unlikely that was real with masks being so scarce these days. Purchased just out of interest to see if they really did come with the masks. Got the green color which showed the 50 masks included. THEY DID NOT. Don’t get your hopes up if you’re expecting N95 facemasks as well.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Advertised 50 Free N95 Mask, Received NO Mask!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Listing states 50 Free N95 Mask, I referred 4 of my friends to buy, they all bought the product that CLEARLY shows 50 Free N95 Mask with the Impact Electronic Ear pieces, myself and ALL 4 friends received there headsets but absolutely NO MASK, VERY Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Do the right thing no matter who is around!

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because it was advertised that 50 N-95 masks would be included. My wife is a nurse and i ordered this to ge tthe masks so she can be safe at work. There were no masks and i cant get a hold of customer service. Id give you zero stars if i could
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Earmuffs said they were coming with 50 N95 Masks.
customer_reviews.text: They did not come with masks. False advertising and waste of time. Now I have to go through this annoying return process.
customer_reviews.author: user15684

customer_reviews.title: Not at advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought it only because they advertised that it comes with N95 masks. But they did not attach it! Just tricked thousands of innocent citizens who bought this to protect themselves from covid19
customer_reviews.author: Mendy

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE of THIS SELLER!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this ear protection is that it was advertised to come with free N95 masks. You should be ashamed of yourself for giving people false hope.
customer_reviews.author: Tomislav M Grujic

customer_reviews.title: Seller lies about product and what comes with it.
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work plain and simple. The ad for this product also stated that they would send 50 free n95 masks with this product. That was a lie and the only reason I bought this specific products. It’s unfortunate that the seller is trying to profit off people’s fear of contracting Coronavirus and dying.
customer_reviews.author: Neena G

customer_reviews.title: These do not muffle the sound of a gunshot.
customer_reviews.text: These are the most ill fitting ear muffs I've ever used. I tried everything to get a good seal around my ears and regardless of what I tried there was a gap at my jawline at the bottom of my ear. I used them this weekend at an indoor shooting range and the sound was deafening. I had to put my old pair of ear muffs on. Unfortunately, I didn't listen to the other negative reviews and watched the video another user posted and decided to buy them partially due to his very knowledgeable sounding review. Wow, what a mistake!! Very sorry I wasted the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Blake

customer_reviews.title: situational awareness, an engineers perspective.
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed by the value of these phones, I made a video. feel free to Check my references, I am a 15 year veteran of Live sound and own a recording studio in Maui [...] I am a Life member of the NRA and a member of the Valley Isle Sport shooters. Shooting is my hobby, sound is my life. I entrust my main professional asset to these head phones.
customer_reviews.author: MauiRifleman

customer_reviews.title: Where are the masks?
customer_reviews.text: Where are 50pcs Free 3M N95 masks as advertised? Amazon and seller should correct this.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not what was promised, i purchased this item because of the N95 masks which never arrived. taking advantage of the pandemic is despicable.
customer_reviews.author: Manhattan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible hearing protection
customer_reviews.text: Horrible hearing protection. Forget all the electronic magic, the muffs alone aren't thick enough to block out very much sound at all. It was no different than putting my hands over my ears. 24 hours later my kid still has a headache after 30 seconds of use. If you do alot of research you'll find that most use ear plugs under these which to me defeats the purpose of wearing muffs.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Elroy

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Was mislead into thinking this purchase came with face masks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scam with masks; none came with order.
customer_reviews.text: Way to scam people into buying these. Advertise ear muffs AND 50 N95 masks as a package deal. And NO masks. My wife works in the medical field, my daughter works on an ambulance, and we're all vol firefighters. The masks would have helped greatly. Seems the advertising is getting sloppy and nothing getting checked or verified.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne R. Jorgensen Jr.

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Free 50 pc N95 masks with the order of the headset? Being an essential worker, I ordered this headset for the N95 and did not receive the masks as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn M

customer_reviews.title: Casual Shooter - Look No Further
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this same noise canceling headphone for nearly a decade now and have had absolutely zero issues that entire time. They make it incredibly easy to hear anything of import around you, including fairly quiet conversation and do a great job protecting your hearing. I picked up a second pair for teaching new shooters and it's been perfect for keeping them comfortable and preventing any stupid mistakes for a first time shooter who doesn't understand the potential hearing damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Still super loud in range.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 3 ear muffs for shooting indoor: This one, rental ear muff and Clear armor 141001. Rental: Greatly reduce the sound to an acceptable level. Honeywell (this one): I can hear super loud sound. Shotguns and big calibers sounds are killing my ears Clear armor: Haven't tried in range, but when listening to music, I can barely hear anything, not like the clear sound when wearing Honeywell one.
customer_reviews.author: ooilioo

customer_reviews.title: There were no masks included
customer_reviews.text: The box had no masks included with the order, just a box of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan R.

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.text: On the Amazon site it indicated that would come with a supply of N95 3M masks. It did NOT. FALSE ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest,,,con men
customer_reviews.text: They said it came with n95 masks,,and both I ordered didnt,,huge false advertising,,trying to use a crisis to push their products,,shameful!@!!disgraceful!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: I'm a pistol instructor, and these let me talk and listen, yet protect my hearing
customer_reviews.text: I've used the cheapie electronic muffs in the past, and while they worked, they're big and clunky, and the ear pads hurt after a while. These are smaller, lighter and more comfortable. They work so well that I can talk with others on the shooting range without raising my voice or straining to hear others, yet the circuitry shuts down gunshots very, very well. I just conducted a class where students shot around 800 rounds over the course of the day. The muffs stayed comfortable and performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Top Down

customer_reviews.title: This is the best value in shooting hearing protection. PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: These are some great headphones. I'd never recommend using these in a combat situation, but for plinking and shooting on the range, these things have great battery life, audio quality, and they're comfortable as well. My only gripe is that they're a little warm on the ears if you're shooting on a hot day, but that's pretty normal with most over-the-ear hearing protection you can get. I believe you can get better gel cups, at least you can for 3M peltors...maybe not these. I have bought a pair for every member of my family and own two of them personally. I cannot recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: DM1986

customer_reviews.title: Totally misled by seller.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the one star review. The seller advertised that this item came with free N95 masks. As a physician we desperately need these to care for patients. I guess it was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Setting the Standard for Shooting Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones that significantly reduce the loud/sharp gunshot noise, while allowing for easily heard conversations and ambient sounds. Honeywell electronics are battle-tested & have a strong reputation. Significant report reduction. What I like best is they are low-profile--not a bulky set of headphones & lightweight. Comfortable for hours of wear & impressive adjustment that allows for personalized levels of sound. (As a side note, Amazon had these at the lowest price I've ever seen and I purchased immediately!) These are world's better compared to another lower-priced model purchased previously, which amplifies the exhaust fan noise at an indoor range that these do not.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.text: Listing states "Free 50 Pcs 3M N95 Respiratory Masks". False advertising. Mine didn't come with free masks. Returned without opening package. Since ad is a lie then shooting protection probably sucks too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: I use these for target shooting and hunting
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these for several years and recommended them to family and friends. I have enjoyed their reliable function both at the range and hunting. I like that I can talk with people while at the range and not have to take ear plugs in and out constantly. I've also begun to use these while deer hunting. I like being able to turn up the volume and use them to amplify noises in the woods. I also use the exterior input and plug it into my phone to listen to music or books while waiting for deer. I definitely recommend them...I have not had any problems since I've purchased these over 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: Really good protection for the price you pay.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned and used several different brands of hearing protection over the last four decades, and I have to say that these are among the very best. The noise cancellation is fast and effective, and the hearing protection without active cancellation is also very good. They’re lightweight and comfortable. These muffs are a real bargain at this price, easily the equal of some more expensive brands.
customer_reviews.author: Chazman

customer_reviews.title: Great Range Gear!! Worth The Price!
customer_reviews.text: Took this to a tactical pistol course, was there with 14 other individuals all shooting at the same time and had instructors giving instruction to me at the same time. HAD NO ISSUE hearing them over the pistols and at the same time the pistol noise was not overly loud. High recommended! Bought a pair for my wife as well! PS could even hear people talking conversationally when the pistols werent being fired about 20 foot away :)
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought some for general range usage, they just don't work great. I use em on the shotgun range to listen to music and shoot with and they do well with that. On the Rifle/Pistol range -> they make all noise louder! Whats the point of that.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn any more
customer_reviews.text: I had these since March of 2017. Almost 3 years from this review. How ever, I have only ever used them half a dozen times. They have been put away in my gun bag and that is it. Even with the batteries out. I don't go shooting that often either. So now they are not turning on. I tried different batteries from cheap Dollar Tree to Rayovac and Duracell. How ever, when they were working, they WORKED!!!! So maybe it was just bad luck or they honestly don't last as long even with minimum usage. Keep in mind, never been dropped, near liquid, squished or tossed to some one else to catch it so they can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Greaves

customer_reviews.title: Overall noise dampening is not good
customer_reviews.text: The overall noise dampening of these is just terrible. I had to put in ear plugs underneath when shooting any rifle round and above ( .223, 7.62, 30-06, etc). It was ok for handguns but even then it was just on the edge of being ok. The sound amplification is great though, love that you can hear conversations and rattle snakes from far away before you get too close. The active dampening was decent when the shot is fired, but again the overall dampening with even the amplification turned off is just really bad. Others in my group agreed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: They look cool, but they don't really help.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't wear JUST these while shooting rifles. Maybe Pistols, where the weapon is far in front of you and the noise isn't as loud as Rifles. But I have issues obtaining a good sight picture with these on. Not only do they interfere with your sight picture, but they don't block out as much sound as you think. I would wear this + insert ear pro just to be on the safe side. Also, do be careful with the volume adjustment setting. Too high and you'll deafen yourself from a nearby gunshot, because it will amplify the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have bought and for the money I can NOT find a better quality/functioning/more comfortable set of hearing protectors for under $300. I shoot weekly, participate in 3 Gun and IDPA, all the while using these and they are great. Pistol, shotgun and rifle fire will NOT be an issue if you use these. Just My Opinion, YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherOpinion

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the added N95 mask - it wasn't included
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product which I've bought several times for $40 off Amazon, however I paid the extra $10 for the included N95 mask which was not in the package so I overpaid for a product I would have bought for $10 less. NOT HAPPY I FEEL TRICKED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work indoors
customer_reviews.text: Not sealing right. Ballcap on, ballcap off, hair away, muffs a but up, down forward, back, doesn't work. Had to put in earplugs underneath while I was in the shooting range while muffs were off, which just means the disposable plugs worked better than this electronic earmuffs. They just don't seem to create a good seal. Update: I've checked out some forums and it was mentioned that the ones being sold from Amazon may be counterfeit. This is in US, Canada & Australia. If I ever buy again, I'd buy direct from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine DLR

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these, but when I first put them on, they did not fit well. They left a gap at the bottom of my ears for sound to enter. Finally, I figured out that there was too much pressure on the top of the earmuffs. Thankfully, I was able to pop the plastic piece off and reverse it. (See photo ) In the long run a minor inconvenience, but I almost returned them so I’m giving them 4/5. After this quick fix, I’m definitely keeping them!
customer_reviews.author: Coastlife

customer_reviews.title: I used to love these... until people without hearing loss tried them.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these from years and I used to LOVE them, but then I got a pair for my new wife and son. Both of them complained of ear pain from the first 5.56 shot. We now double these with foam earplugs, but it sucks knowing that the only reason these worked for me was because my hearing loss was already so bad from previous firefights that I didn’t notice how ineffective they are. It also sucks that they chose to do a weird size for the radio jack, you should be able to plug a standard phone or radio jack into the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Tough Nut

customer_reviews.title: Poor audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, the audio quality was not natural I’ve use three other brands of electronic noise reduction headsets for the shooting sports and these are by far the worst. The sound quality is very poor not natural. That’s it to my head was like they were shaped for a head of a fat man. Not only was this uncomfortable but it also did not seal well against noise. I am currently using a pair of Caldwell Over the head hearing protection that are very inexpensive I provide more natural hearing. They are large but fit well.
customer_reviews.author: B R D upstate NY

customer_reviews.title: Real or fake these are abysmal...
customer_reviews.text: Used these for training in Las Vegas...they're really cheap feeling and didn't work as I had expected given reviews. They would occasionally seem to block the loud bangs but felt like nothing at all sometimes. The quality of these just isn't there especially for the price...I would have rather had a hardier set for a bit more. I wouldn't recommend these at all. Even loaned to my mom when she went to an outdoor range for training and she used em for like 2 mins before switching to regular ol muffs. Save your money and buy better. I'd return these pieces of trash if I could.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. McConnell

customer_reviews.title: It Will Be Hard to Use Regular Ear Muffs Again
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of electronic ear muffs. I bought this specific pair due to online reviews and recommendations. I am not disappointed. These things are great! You can leave them on and hear normal conversation, but it will deaden the loud sounds while you are shooting. If you are hard of hearing from all that shooting before getting these, you can turn up the volume during conversation to hear even better. I don't think I will ever go back to normal ear muffs again after using these.
customer_reviews.author: tb67

customer_reviews.title: Both in a row stopped working after about 20 minutes use
customer_reviews.text: When I first used these I was very impressed. They amplify surrounding sound but instantly block out loud noises. I order another pair after my first use. The problem is that with only about 30 minutes of light use they just stopped working. Now they amplify all noise including loud noises. I contacted customer service for Howard Leigh but they are worthless. It's too bad these are junk because the concept is good. Does anyone make a durable version of this technology?
customer_reviews.author: Damon Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Received a fake headset
customer_reviews.text: After roughly 2 years of owning it, the speaker on the volume control side has stopped working. Initially it would work but would go in and out until it finally wouldn't produce any sound. I looked into it and found out that the item i received was counterfeit based on the springs for the negative battery terminals rather than the tension clip. I wish i received some sort of notification where as other customers were able to receive some sort of compensation.
customer_reviews.author: fr0sty

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Quite impressive. Great amplification, especially if you are having some hearing difficulties. Fits well once I figured out how to extend the cups from the band. Low profile, stays out of the way of the rifle. Volume control is large and well placed. Easy to adjust, even with gloves. Light on the head, can wear for extended times. Additional input for MP3 player is great for running the mower and the tractor! I connect it to my two way radio, and when a call comes in, I hear it. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of my son, who is an Army vet. The slim ear cups allow easy usage with a rifle. The noise cancellation is excellent - even indoors - while still providing clear hearing of normal sounds and speech. You can even use these electronic earmuffs to watch TV when there's a late night need to keep the TV volume low. Just set the TV volume at the courtesy night time setting and crank up the volume of the earmuff and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice. I purchase them because my brother had a pair. honestly my only disappointment was I relied on the batteries that came in the box. I was in my hunting blind and they wound up dying on me. The next day I put new batteries in and they worked just fine. It actually help me shoot a deer this year. You can actually hear better with these things on than without. I could hear two deer walking in before they were even in front of my blind. I would highly recommend them for any type of shooting you're doing for ear protection.
customer_reviews.author: dwayne lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Defective. Broke after only 2 and a half months
customer_reviews.text: I loved these. I really did. But now only one ear works. I was at an Action Pistol shoot today and one side kept glitching and squawking. I found the problem (see pic) - the connection for the mic and driver on the right ear piece were loose and came off as I removed the foam cover. I want to return these, but Amazon won't let me. I have had these for 12 weeks and shot with them about 5 times. Very disappointed in the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one glaring flaw.
customer_reviews.text: These are all around good headphones for use in loud environments when you still need to hear ambient sounds like conversations. My one complaint is that they are very sensitive to electromagnetic energy - if you walk near a Wi-Fi access point, use a cellphone, etc. you'll hear noise in the amplified audio. If you connect an audio cable from the headphones to your cellphone, you'll hear noise when the phone's radios are operating. Otherwise, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Witkowski

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: I am a disabled vet with hearing loss. Oh how I wish they would have had these in the 80's and 90's while I was mechanic on 60k -200kw generators. No more. Ear plugs for me. Now I can hear what someone is saying at the range or any loud situation without having to take out ear plugs and insert my hearing aids. Folks these are great. Take care of your ears. Hearing loss just sneaks up on you and one day "bam" never the same. I ordered a second pair for my wife. She loves them too.
customer_reviews.author: moonatic

customer_reviews.title: The best you can buy
customer_reviews.text: These are literally the best shooting range headphones. I have fired several different pistols and a couple shot guns and I gotta say u cant hear the noise of the gunshot. For those of you who dont really understand how they work...they cancel out high decibel sounds. Ex. U can barely hear a gun shot but it will amplify a whisper. I have even taken them to play paintball so I can hear my team members from a distance without them giving away their position.
customer_reviews.author: rroswell1

customer_reviews.title: Replaced junk with more junk.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a cheap set probably made in china that lasted a month and the on off started spinning around but not turning on or off or controlling volume. Bought a set of Howard Leight muffs and after 3.5 months, past the Amazon return period the right speaker started going off and on and now mostly stays off. Replaced junk with more expensive junk. Try to get customer service and it takes me to Honeywell and a maze that goes nowhere. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenoldie

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and allow normal conversation
customer_reviews.text: These are a great addition to my range bag! I can still have conversation while shooting. They are comfortable to wear. I even found them helpful for a game of paint ball. Not so much for the ear protection but the ability to hear a sneaking opponent in the thick woods!
customer_reviews.author: Toddp

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit (too big)
customer_reviews.text: If you are using these make sure they have a proper fit. Ear protection is worthless if they do not fit properly. These are very thin and have almost no noise dampening material inside. On top of that, they fit way too big. There was a big gap on the lower left corner. I purchased the Peltor Tactical Sport 300's and they have a much nice fit, they make a perfect seal all around my ears. Also, if you shoot at an indoor shooting range PLEASE double up with foam ear plugs. Even if these fit properly I cannot believe they offer enough protection on their own. Protect your hearing.
customer_reviews.author: luis pina

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've made
customer_reviews.text: If you shoot in or Outdoors you need these. These work so well at isolating the loud bangs and pops but keeping conversations perfectly audible. It has a built-in volume adjuster so you can adjust it how you like. When the two double A batteries die, it functions as a regular shooting earmuff. You can also connect this to any phone or music player to listen to music as headphones while you shoot which is so cool. I should have bought these years ago and at this price I'm foolish not to. Seriously pick these up! I even use them when I'm hammering or sawing parts on my car so I don't damage my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: EkV

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money, [sound] investment
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these to anyone who's serious about being able to do all three: 1) have a conversation at the range 2) safeguard their hearing 3) comfortably shoot a wide range of calibers with minimal adjustments to their hearing protection (if any). For the money - this ear protection is second-to-none, and way more comfortable than ear plugs. They also fit very well around all sorts of ball caps / hats, and the sizing is very easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: David Fox

customer_reviews.title: Serious Review
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awesome. They fit perfect over my ears and it does very well in noise cancellation. When you turn the headphones on (batteries are included) at the low volume you can still shoot and not kill your ears. It gives you an adjustable volume to hear normal inside voice talking. They come with an aux cable which I am not sure what to use for other than listen to music while your at the range. These headphones fold up to be nice and compact to not take up that much space. I would recommend these for indoor and outdoor shooting with any caliber.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Durable, Excellent Quality Electronic Earmuffs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 'Howard Leight by Honeywell Impact Sport Sound Amplification Electronic Shooting Earmuff, Classic Green (R-01526), and at this exceptionally affordable, low purchase price, they've exceeded my expectations, and are exactly what I've been searching for and needed. You can't beat the quality at this price point. They also arrived the same day that I ordered them, and were perfectly packaged and well protected. All in all, i give this 5 stars, and would most definitely recommend this to all my lady and gents out there.
customer_reviews.author: ⚡K⚡

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with these noise suppressing headphones. Previously I owned a pair of Caldwell E-Max Low Profile headphones that I used for several years and they worked quite well but these headphones are vastly superior. The amount of volume control on these is very precise as opposed to the Caldwell product. They are vastly more well built as well. The ear pieces are slim enough to accomodate all but the thickest rifle gun stocks. The clarity of voices that can be heard is terrific given the ability to suppress loud gun reports. Buy with confidence, these really work well!
customer_reviews.author: Havana Harry

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pair and I have tried several!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best cost value pair of ear protection I have owned. Now you see the other brands who are generally over priced have started to copy this design. Indoors or outdoor the noise canceling works great yet you can have a conversation. Used them in training out doors and no matter where the instructor was on the range I could here them just fine! I highly recommend these! I had the “w” brand and the head band broke.....several calls and emails and no response from “w” customer service. So I changed brands and I like the over all design of these.
customer_reviews.author: R E Hogwild

customer_reviews.title: Did not include the free M95 mask.
customer_reviews.text: The product works well as described. One thing though. It was advertised to include 50 m95 mask. I did not receive the 50 free M95 mask.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped
customer_reviews.text: Competition shooter here. Picked up these due to sheer popularity it seems like everybody has these.. the sound manipulation is great, it's not disctracting and is clear, and they are slim profile. However the build quality of the muff itself is total junk. It doesn't adjust easily, doesn't seal around my ears, almost no padding, dreadful material quality, and not so great db reduction. I do not recommend these but perhaps if you don't mind your environment a little louder- I like it quiet so I use plugs and muffs. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hind

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product or Just A Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: I must have a faulty product. There is no noise canceling feature in the head set. The volume knob simply adjusts how much of the outside noise it lets in (regardless of what it is.) It seems no different than having no ear protection in since it jut amplifies bad noises and they all still over power people speaking. There is also a intermittent buzzing noise that occurs every 5-10 seconds. It’s quiet annoying. I have Peltors and they work much better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: Perfect noise cancelation. You won't hear gunshots, but you will be able to hear the range officers, and your friends perfectly. The batteries have lasted months so far. These are also very comfortable. You will forget you're wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: The audio is good
customer_reviews.text: The fit was tight, but OK. Just fine for short term use, would probably be uncomfortable for hours of wearing. The sound decrease with no audio on was OK. With the audio on it could be adjusted so that it was hard to tell if the headset was on or not for normal sound levels. Or it could be adjusted to amplify normal sound levels a bit. The directional characteristics were good, the sound location with the earmuffs on seemed normal.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R

customer_reviews.title: They're decent especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price they're decent. I like the two audio pickups. You have real stereo discernation. I wouldn't trust them in the rain. Not weatherproofed in any way. Battery compartment is not gasketed and audio in jack has no weather plug. Don't expect hi-fi music listening out of them either (i did not expect, just saying). The on/off/volume wheel is easy to find / manipulate even with light tac gloves on. Took to the range & had no problem saving my ears from a 5.56 sbr with muzzle break while allowing clear conversation in between. I grabbed a US Tactical sewing band cover for them and fit like a champ. No regerts. : )
customer_reviews.author: Derek Brown

customer_reviews.title: These work okay - they are very big!
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I have a somewhat narrow head. These are huge on me. If they are covering my ears on the smallest "setting" the strap that goes over the top of your head doesn't even touch my head. I have to always wear a hat to make them work. They wouldn't even come close to being small enough to fit on my wife's head. I tried on some other brands at the gun range and they actually have different sizes. These are supposed to be a one-size-fits-all..?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for target practice.
customer_reviews.text: Very good for target practice. The earphones are battery operated and can suppress and enhance the sound. It is not large and is compact and makes a required addition to the trip to the gun range. It is good for both pistols and rifles. As a caution I also rely on earplugs on top of this and have double protection. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Smith

customer_reviews.title: Meant for very large heads
customer_reviews.text: I could not get a good deal with these no matter what I did. With the band on my head, the cups were past my ears. No seal. Adjusted as small as they would go. Did this even wearing a hat. The cups are way too long. Need to be wider and shorter. I'm 6'2", 240lbs. Not exactly tiny. Didn't even install the batteries. Kinda pointless to do if they don't seal. Quality construction though. Felt well built. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SW2

customer_reviews.title: Hurts ears, elec. do not work.
customer_reviews.text: Used these for shooting. Are really tight around the ears even though I have a medium sized head and ears; painful after awhile. Not comfortable at all. Electronics went out shortly after I bought them. The reviews indicate the maker is not prone to listen to complaints nor are they customer satisfaction oriented so I did not try to have them fixed as it was not cost effective. Now use my 3M 95 cheapies...suit me just fine at a fraction of the cost; well padded and much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: One ear buzzing and different volume in each ear.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box I put the batteries in and the left ear starts buzzing. I also notice a significant difference in volume from left to right. I am going to take them shooting today and decide if I should order a replacement or return. Not impressed so far. Update: Took them shooting. I thought it was supposed to muffle the sound of gun fire. I can hear the gunshots clear as day. The difference in volume from left to right ear was very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Does not seal on average sized heads
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling works well enough and I had high hopes as the price seemed more than reasonable. But the way the electronics cords are run they keep the muffs from rotating to sit Flush on your ears so you end up only wearing them for the looks. I had a whole pile of people try these and it didn’t fit anyone including full grown hefty adults. If you have a watermelon for a head I guess you are in luck. If you bend the cords to the opposite side of the muff steel wires then they kind of work but no longer fold. I’m going back to peltors that last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: akcowboy

customer_reviews.title: Poor seal around the ear
customer_reviews.text: The product does dampen the sound, but the headphones have such a poor seal at the bottom of the headphones around the ear that they do not protect my hearing efficiently. I had multiple people try them (to make sure that I just didn’t have a funny shipped head or something) and all of them said the same thing. I did not even feel comfortable attempting to use them at the range due to the poor seal. I have switched to another brand and have had no issues. I will be returning these headphones and asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Magee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a couple years ago for our son. We wanted something that he could wear while shooting, but could still hear us and anything around him (without having to take them off all the time). He wears these while he's practicing and he wears these on hunts. He loves them and so do we! His Grandfather liked them so much he asked for them for Christmas this year! He's hard of hearing and finds these are a huge help while he's out in the woods. These pick up the sounds around you and you can set the volume where you are comfortable. Would recommend these for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: JPlattinum

customer_reviews.title: Amazing technology!
customer_reviews.text: I researched many brands at different costs..these are such a great deal..they range from $30- over $200 ..these are the absolute best for the money..very slim, and so proper at the range..it's great to hear range marshalls' commands, yet surpressed firing noises..much safer than non electronic earphones..and when I saw how quality these are, I bought an inexpensive hard carrying case in the same green color for about $10 ..if you buy a mini bluetooth/wireless receiver, and plug it into the earphone jack, these beautiful earphones become Bluetooth enabled so you can play music from your phone..good stereo sound for music too..I'm veryyyyyy happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it would be...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be of better quality than my Caldwell muffs but nope...it's worse. It does not have a firm fit so it really doesn't serve it's purpose. The audio volume does not cancel out as nicely as my cheap Caldwell muffs. I would not recommend this to anyone. There are way better quality muffs out there that are the same price or even for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Wang Lee

customer_reviews.title: Does not seal well witH my head unlike others
customer_reviews.text: For some reason it doesn’t seal well on my head. I was getting defanging sound leaks from pressure waves. I manually compressed them to make a better seal but without holding it down mine just wasn’t working right. I bought a Walker Razor Patriot and it works so much better at sealing with my head. I keep it in my range bag as a backup and I’ve also let my wife use it along with noise blocking ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Pitogo

customer_reviews.title: Great, Lightweight headset
customer_reviews.text: Used them at an indoor range. Didn't need to turn to volume up to much, they were perfect. Muffled the shot very well and I could still hear the range master clearly. Took my grandson to an outdoor range. Again, adjusted to volume to fit the environment (about half volume) and they were perfect. Muffled the shots very well, I could talk to and hear the range master very clearly. For those that say the headset is 'to loud' need to adjust the volume down, simple. If the radio is to loud you turn it down, right? Great product. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor long gun
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for a shotgun tournament recently. I was a bit concerned as they didn't seem to block out a lot of noise "just wearing them around" and the fit isn't as tight as I'm used to for an indoor headset. These were very comfortable wearing around for a couple of hours. They seemed to block out any painful levels of the shotgun and it was nice to be able to have conversations. I could even hear birds chirping, which I'm not used to when wearing hearing protection.
customer_reviews.author: bjjjcr

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite head sets
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need a head set with radio communications then these are great I think I use these more then my peltors if I don't need a radio and in the 50.00 range vs 600.00 it's a much better deal my hearing is getting pretty bad so at home practicing on the range it's a major plus to turn up the volume around others and still have the noise cancelling of the head set I say short of military use these are the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but may not fit you well.
customer_reviews.text: These do a nice job of sound attenuation, and the ambient sound amplification is impressive. Unfortunately, I can't wear these for more than about 30 minutes before they really start to become uncomfortable. They just don't fit quite right, and the padding on each ear is not thick enough to get a snug fit. On my head, they fit snugly above my ears, but they don't fit snugly at the bottom of each ear cup. Not sure it's worth $50+ when you can get a much cheaper set with more padding.
customer_reviews.author: dedm21079

customer_reviews.title: Bought TWICE and defective each time!!!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE PRODUCT. I’ve bought these TWICE and nearly went deaf at the range from them. The noise canceling feature simply DOES NOT WORK but instead allows the gun fire to be amplified along with all other sounds. DO NOT BUY THEM!!!
customer_reviews.author: Xenomorph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Mowing
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my dad so he can listen to podcasts and music while mowing. He was using a cheap pair of earbuds that weren’t worth what he paid. I wanted to get something that would protect his hearing while still allowing him to listen to his phone. He loves them. I tried them out for myself to see how well they worked. They keep the noise from the lawn mower to a minimum so I don’t have to blast my music at full volume. I was able to keep my music about halfway and it was perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable priced ear muff that really works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've taken it out hunting for waterfowl and tested these out and they really work. They also keep my ears warm in the morning. I was playing for the volume and it seem like the person was right next to me talking but really they were all about 15 feet from me. I am going to order another one so I can have one in each backpack so I won't forget. I would recommend this to anyone for target range, hunting, or just wear it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: BEESRR

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Set of Ears, I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very good, especially while instructing at the range; however, if I did not need the microphone feature (which turns up all sounds around you, while muffling the Shot sound. When quiet out , u can hear and understand a whisper. If I wanted a set to protect my ears while I go & shoot... I’d get the “pro fo sho” for an unbeatable $16 to $17 American; my wife & kids (adult/teenagers) wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Great earmuffs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted earmuffs that I could actually hear range commands with and still have good ear protection. These work perfectly! I've been told I wear them backwards by several people. I'm a pretty practical person so I think I have them on right and everyone else is wrong. I wear them with the mic part to the rear and the hard shell part forward. Makes sense to me that the sound I want to block out is in front of me and the stuff I want to hear is behind me. Just makes sense to me but didn't stop the range gurus from correcting me. Buy them, they are a excellent addition to your range bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good for kids
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my boys when we are shooting guns. They absolutely love them. They can hear people when they are talking but they don’t hear the guns shots. Would recommend these for any parent that needs noise canceling earmuffs for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: style - it has the outdoor looking and made of high-quality materials. fit - perfectly fit over the ears; a bit on the heavy side and wear long time could feel pinching sometimes when it shifts around the ears. noise blocking - needs one AAA battery, it effectively blocks noises from machines. volume button easily reachable and adjustable - make conversation easy to engage. I put it over my earbuds while mowing the yard. I now can hear the music without struggling through the lawn mower noise. recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase to preserve ears while a gun range officer
customer_reviews.text: When I was going to spend a good part of a week, from 6:30am to 5:00pm on the rifle ranges at Camp Perry's Civilian Marksmanship Program's National Matches, I figured I needed something more than my custom made ear plugs, so I got these earmuffs which worked very well. They could be taken on or off or perched on my head; their ability to fold compactly let them fit easily into my range bag. I don't wish to sacrifice my very good hearing on a gun range. These seem to do the trick although I didn't keep the audio on long enough to test its four hour limit. A good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.Deal

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.  Do your homework. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm having bad luck these days with Amazon and quality products. I definitely WOULD NOT recommend these for an INDOOR shooting range. My old 3M Peltor 95's did a much better job and WAY more comfortable. I was seduced in buying these because I wore ones similar in a manufacturing facility and the amplifier did a wonderful job of letting me hear others speak to me. Very disappointing. I actually wouldn't recommend these for, well, anything. They simply do not fit over the ears right despite my best efforts. I thought perhaps the problem was me learning to adjust them correctly, but when I put on my Peltor's, no issue getting a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: ExNYer72

customer_reviews.title: These things do the job!
customer_reviews.text: I use these at my gun club. I am a rifle shooter. These work better than any ear muff I have ever owned. Today I am eighty and I have been shooting since I was a teenager. Today I have to wear hearing aids to hear with. Who knows if I had had and used these how I could hear now. Well anyway, I now can fit these over my ears and turn the volume up with my hearing aids in place and shoot in comfort. I can hear people talking quite clearly and yet they shut off the sound when a gun fires. Take it from me, if you are around guns, you need these.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wynne

customer_reviews.title: Battery installation was easy and the use of the headset was pretty straightforward
customer_reviews.text: 02-23-18: Original review (Possible update in the future). They work... ok. Battery installation was easy and the use of the headset was pretty straightforward. I like how you can adjust the hearing sensitivity to amplify speaker's voices. My complaint is that I expected more sound dampening from these headsets (I used to have the traditional big earmuffs meant for construction). However, I will admit that's a personal preference and I may just double up with some foam ear protection as well. Otherwise, at least I can get used to the sound and work on my flinch response? Heh Further testing and use required, but well, they DO work and are very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are hard to beat. I got these for personal use and for suppressed/handgun shooting they work well on a low setting. Cheekweld is about as good as muffs can be shooting upright with an AR-style stock, not much worse than Peltors. The only thing I dislike about these is that they don't come with from the factory with Noisefighter gel cups. Those are definitely worth getting if you plan on frequent use with eyepro.
customer_reviews.author: Jozsef C.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Im very disappointed in this product. I read very good things and met a few people at the range who suggested I buy it. But when I used it at the range it did not hold a seal to my ears and block out the sound. I had to buy a pair of orange foam throw aways they were selling at the range. That being said the amplifier worked and i could hear very clearly but it did not cut off the sound when the noise level exceeded 82 db.
customer_reviews.author: robert horton

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND PROTECTION.... HOWEVER
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ear protection across the board, but I do have a few things to point out (may not apply to someone based on what they are shooting). I found that shooting my rifles these earmuffs can be quite annoying in a sense that they get in the way of the rifle stock.... I would much rather use the cheap ear foams instead when shooting rifles. Also my AR15 is still super loud with these... idk if they are just made for pistols or smaller calibers or what. Besides that, these are great for pistol shooting and still even rifles, just keep in mind what I described above!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Good at the range and for work.
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise it does work well at a indoor range. It madde communicating with the range officer and the other shooter I was with easy. I also use it a work. I have used it while cutting grass and running a chain saw with our security radio hooked up. It worked great. I could hear them when they called me over the equipment running. I do plan on buying a couple more for myself as gifts and for my staff.
customer_reviews.author: John D Powell

customer_reviews.title: Best quality for an amazing price. Don't look any further.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing I can't hear high frequency noise and with these I can. They work great for shooting and hunting. No more asking "what"? When trying to whisper in the woods. Makes shooting at the range a pleasure. I've already recomend them to other people. Going to buy a pair for my wife too. Such a good product. I would never recommend a product without it being of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Too tight, but no other option
customer_reviews.text: I had scheduled to return this item but, truthfully, all the others I've considered block the sound of gunfire but do not amplify ambient sounds (like range instructions) and are cheaply made (I know, I just put one in the trash!) There are other people at my club who have these, so I don't know an alternative. They are uncomfortable (very tight and I have a small head), amplify ambient sound just fine but I still hear my firearm (even though I'm told the muffs bring it "down" to a "safe" level). Guess I'm stuck. Hope I don't go deaf lol. AND I hope they don't stop working like the last muff did.
customer_reviews.author: Ellzeena

product_meta.title: Howard Leight by Honeywell Impact Sport Sound Amplification Electronic Shooting Earmuff
product_meta.description: Howard Leight Impact Sport Electronic Earmuffs provide protection from damaging noises over 82 , while amplifying regular ambient sounds such as conversation, range commands, etc. Features include a ventilated inner headband to minimize pressure on the head, durable outer headband to withstand abuse, snap-in ear cushions, directional stereo microphones, Quick-Click headband height adjustment and an of 22 . This unit also comes equipped with an audio input jack and cord for your MP3 player and other audio devices for listening off the field. Use the integrated power and volume knob to control the volume, and the external audio plug for your favorite media player. These electronic muffs fold up easily for compact convenient storage.
feature_bullets: Built-in directional microphones amplify range commands and other ambient sounds to a safe 82 dB, providing more natural listening and enhanced communication
Actively listens and automatically shuts off amplification when ambient sound reaches 82 dB; Noise Reduction Rating (NRR): 22
Features low profile earcups for firearm stock clearance; adjustable headband for secure fit; compact folding design for convenient storage; classic green color
Includes AUX input and 3.5 mm connection cord for MP3 players and scanners. Integrated power/volume knob
Includes 2 AAA batteries; automatic shut-off feature after 4 hours increases battery life; approximately 350 hours of battery life; works well and long with Polaroid AAA Batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
